otmf.fields_tools module¶

Created on Mon Feb 1 09:23:11 2016

author:Jean-Baptiste Courbot - jb.courbot@unistra.fr
date:Sep 01, 2017 (created Feb 01, 2016)
otmf.fields_tools.gen_beta(vois, angle)[source]¶

Computation of the outputs of the weighting function given neighbor position and values of V (angle).

Parameters:
  • vois (ndarray) – stack of neighbor number
  • angle (ndarray) –

    priviledged directions / values of V

    param ndarray beta:
     values generated in the lookuptable.
otmf.fields_tools.get_num_voisins(x, y, image)[source]¶

Retrieving of local pixel neighborhood numbering, accounting for borders.

The following numbering is used :

y+1 | 6 | 5 | 4 |

y | 7 | | 3 |

y-1 | 0 | 1 | 2 |

x-1 | x | x+1

Note : by convention, non-existing neighbor are labeled ‘-1’.

Parameters:
  • x (float) – x-position of pixel in image
  • y (float) – y-position of pixel in image
  • image (ndarray) – concerned image, actually used for its size only.
Returns:

voisins (ndarray) - set of neighbor number
otmf.fields_tools.get_vals_voisins_tout(image)[source]¶

Retrieving of local pixel neighborhood values, accounting for borders.

The following numbering is used :

y+1 | 6 | 5 | 4 |

y | 7 | | 3 |

y-1 | 0 | 1 | 2 |

x-1 | x | x+1

Note that along borders, pixels values are duplicated.

Parameters:image (ndarray) – concerned image, actually used for its size only.
Returns:vals (ndarray) - set of neighboring values aranges in (xdim, ydim, 9) array.
otmf.fields_tools.init_champs(par)[source]¶

Set a random intialization for the class field X.

Parameters:par (parameter) – parameter set of the Gibbs sampling
Returns:X_init (ndarray) Initialization for X.
otmf.fields_tools.phi_theta(a, b)[source]¶

Weighting function to account for orientation in Ising models.

Parameters:
  • a (float) – first parameter
  • b (floas) – second parameter
otmf.fields_tools.psi_ising(x_1, x_2, alpha)[source]¶

Ising potential function

Parameters:
  • x_1 (float) – first argument of the potential, eventually ndarray.
  • x_2 (float) – second argument, eventually ndarray of the same size that x_1.
  • alpha (float) – granularity parameter
Returns:

res (ndarray) - output of the potential, eventually ndarray.

otmf.gibbs_sampler module¶

Created on Mon Feb 1 14:59:34 2016

@author: courbot

otmf.gibbs_sampler.calc_likelihood(Y, x_range, multi, par)[source]¶

Compute the likelihood of Y given all possible classes and the noise parameters.

Note To be simplified.

This function does not acount for the FSF.

Parameters:
  • Y (ndarray) – Hyperspectral observation
  • x_range (ndarray) – set of possible x
  • multi (bool) – deprecated
  • par (parameter) – parameter set of the Gibbs sampling
Returns:

likelihood_y (ndarray) Likelihood values, aranged in (x-dim,y-dim, number of classes).
otmf.gibbs_sampler.calc_proba_xyv(x_range, id_x, v, likelihood, vals, vals_v, Beta, alpha, alpha_v, vois)[source]¶
otmf.gibbs_sampler.calc_proba_xyv_pi(x_range, v_range, id_x, v, likelihood, use_y, vals, vals_v, Beta, pi, alpha, alpha_v, vois)[source]¶

Compute p(X, V|x_neighbor, v_neighbor, y)

Parameters:
  • x_range (ndarray) – possible values for x
  • v_range (ndarray) – possible values for v
  • id_x (int) – indice of x classe.
  • id_x – value of v.
  • likelihood (ndarray) – likelihood of x,v given y.
  • use_y (bool) – set if we use an observation y [True] or not [False]
  • vals (ndarray) – x neighbor values
  • vals_v (ndarray) – v neighbor values
  • pi (ndarray) – prior parameter.
  • phi (ndarray) – precomputed value of phi.
  • alpha (ndarray) – prior “granularity” parameter.
Returns:

proba_courant (ndarray) probability computation.
otmf.gibbs_sampler.cast_angles(V, v_range)[source]¶
otmf.gibbs_sampler.gen_champs_fast(par, generate_v, generate_x, use_y, normal=False, use_pi=True, icm=False)[source]¶

Markov field simulation, either by Gibbs sampling or ICM.

Parameters:
  • par (parameter) – parameter set of the Gibbs sampling
  • generate_v (bool) – set if we generate [True] or know [False] the V array (orientations).
  • generate_x (bool) – set if we generate [True] or know [False] the X array (classes).
  • use_y (bool) – set if we know [True] or ignore [False] an observation Y.
  • normal (bool) – set if we use the standard [True] or chromatic [False] Gibbs sampler. The second one is faster by several order of magnitude on large images.
  • icm (bool) – set if the realization is deterministic (ICM) or not (Gibbs).
Returns:

par (ParamsGibbs) parameter containing the simulation output.
otmf.gibbs_sampler.get_dir(X, par)[source]¶

otmf.mpm module¶

Created on Thu Feb 22 16:15:53 2018

@author: courbot

otmf.mpm.MPM_uncert(pargibbs, tmf)[source]¶

MPM segmentation method. Used in parrallel processing here.

Parameters:
  • pargibbs (parameter) – parameters of the Gibbs sampling.
  • tmf (bool) – set if we are in the Triplet Markov Field [True] of Hidden Markov Field [False].
Returns:

X_mpm_est (ndarray) MPM estimation of X
Returns:

V_mpm_est (ndarray) MPM estimation of V
Returns:

Ux_map (ndarray) Uncertainty map, supplementing the X segmentation.
Returns:

Uv_map (ndarray) Uncertainty map, supplementing the V segmentation.
otmf.mpm.serie_gibbs(pargibbs, nb_rea, generate_v, generate_x, use_y, use_pi, tmf=True)[source]¶

Generate a serie of Gibbs sampling using the same parameters.

This functions uses multiprocessing.
Parameters:
  • pargibbs (misc) – parameters of the Gibbs sampling.
  • nb_rea (int) – set how many independant sampling there will be.
Returns:

pargibbs (parameter) parameters containing the Gibbs samples.

otmf.parameter_estimation module¶

This module contains all the functions related to parameter estimation. :author: Jean-Baptiste Courbot - jb.courbot@unistra.fr :date: Sep 01, 2017 (created Apr 20, 2016)

otmf.parameter_estimation.SEM(parseg, parchamp, pargibbs, disp=False)[source]¶

Stochastic Expectation-Maximization algorithm.

This iterative method allows, at each iteration, a parameter re-estimation directly from complete data thanks to realization of the missing data, simulated using parameters estimated at the previous step.

See the original works from Celeux and Diebolt.

Parameters:
  • parseg (parameters) – parameters ruling the segmentation method
  • parchamp (parameters) – parameters of the model (priors, noise parameters)
  • pargibbs (parameters) – parameters of the Gibbs sampling.
  • disp (bool) – set the verbose mode [True]
Returns:

parchamp (parameter) - set of estimated parameters
otmf.parameter_estimation.est_kmeans(Y, x_range, multi=False)[source]¶

Simple routine for running K-means clustering on an hyperspectral image.

Parameters:
  • Y (ndarray) – Hyperspectral image aranged as (spatial,spatial,spectral)
  • x_range (ndarray) – Classes (clusters) to recover.
  • multi (bool) – Set if we search for only 2 classes [False] or not [True].
Returns:

X_km – Classification image.
Return type:

ndarray
otmf.parameter_estimation.est_param_de_x(X)[source]¶

Estimation of the \(\alpha\) parameter from a realization \(X=x\).

Parameters:X (ndarray) – Values taken by \(x\)
Returns:alpha (float) - estimation of the \(\alpha\) parameter
otmf.parameter_estimation.est_param_noise(X, Y, parchamp, x_range)[source]¶

Noise parameter estimation from complete data.

The mean and variance estimators are based on standard pseudo maximum-likelihood estimators.

Parameters:
  • X (ndarray) – “hidden” classification
  • Y (ndarray) – Hyperspectral observation, arranged in x, y, lambda.
  • parchamp (misc) – parameters of the model (priors, noise parameters)
  • x_range (ndarray) – possibles values for x
Returns:

parchamp (parameter) - set of estimated parameters
otmf.parameter_estimation.est_pi(X, V, pargibbs)[source]¶

Estimation of the prior parameter pi.

Parameters:
  • X (ndarray) – “hidden” classification
  • V (ndarray) – “hidden” orientations
  • pargibbs (misc) – parameters of the Gibbs sampling.
Returns:

pi_est (ndarray) - Estimated values of pi.
otmf.parameter_estimation.gen_cov(W, sig, rho_1, rho_2)[source]¶

Generate a 5-band covariance matrix given the standard deviation + correlation parameters.

Parameters:
  • W (int) – spectral width of the covariance matrix to create.
  • sig (float) – standard deviation
  • rho_1 (float) – correlation between two adjacent spectral bands.
  • rho_2 (float) – correlation between one band and the off-by-two neighbor band.
Returns:

Sigma (ndarray) - Covariance matrix
otmf.parameter_estimation.get_parcov(Sigma)[source]¶

Estimate the three parameter ruling a penta-diagonal covariance matrix, with identical values along the diagonals.

Parameters:Sigma (ndarray) – Covariance matrix
Returns:
  • sigma (float) – Estimated value of the scalar covariance.
  • rho1 (float) – Estimated value of the 1-offset term.
  • rho2 (float) – Estimated value of the 2-offset term.
otmf.parameter_estimation.init_params(pargibbs, parchamp)[source]¶

Initialize a parameter set :param misc pargibbs: parameters of the Gibbs sampling. :param misc parchamp: parameters of the model (priors, noise parameters) :returns: parchamp (parameter) - set of estimated parameters :returns: X_courant (ndarray) - instance of X which the parameter are estimated

otmf.parameter_estimation.maj_parchamp(parchamp, mu, sig, rho1, rho2, alpha, alpha_v)[source]¶

Set all values as fields of the parchamp class.

otmf.parameter_estimation.mesure_ecart(A_tout, A, mu_tout, mu, pi_tout, pi, taille_fen, W)[source]¶

Measures the gap between parameters and an average of a parameter serie.

Since parameters are inhomogenous, gaps are normalized and computed parameter-wise. :param A_tous: Sequence of matrices. :type A_tous: ndarray :param A: Single matrix. :type A: ndarray :param mu_tous: Sequence of vectors (mean parameter). :type mu_tous: ndarray :param mu_tous: Single vector. :type mu_tous: ndarray :param pi_tous: Sequence of vectors. :type pi_tous: ndarray :param pi: Single vector. :type pi: ndarray :param taille_fen: Window lenght in which the averaging is performed. :type taille_fen: int :param W: DEPRECATED. :type W: ind

Returns:ecarts – 1D array containing relative gaps.
Return type:ndarray

otmf.segmentation module¶

This module contains the image segmentation functions.

author:Jean-Baptiste Courbot - jb.courbot@unistra.fr
date:Sep 01, 2017 (created Nov 03, 2015)
otmf.segmentation.seg_otmf(parseg, pargibbs, superv=False, disp=False)[source]¶

Segmentation of the image/ hyperspectral image.

Parameters:
  • parseg (misc) – parameters ruling the segmentation method
  • pargibbs (misc) – parameters of the Gibbs sampling.
  • superv (bool) – set if the segmentation is supervized or not.
  • disp (bool) – trigger the verbose mode.
Returns:

X_est (ndarray) X segmentation
Returns:

V_est (ndarray) V segmentation
Returns:

X_mpm (ndarray) Sequence of X Gibbs samples used for the MPM segmentation.
Returns:

V_mpm (ndarray) Sequence of X Gibbs samples used for the MPM segmentation.
Returns:

parsem (parameter) Parameters estimated with the SEM method.
